info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 10:16PM EDT until April 7 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Hocking River at Athens affecting Athens County.
For the Hocking River...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Hocking River at Athens.
* WHEN...Until Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...Impacts...At 18.0 feet, In Nelsonville, the baseball fields along Watkins Street flood. At 20.0 feet, Low areas, campground, and private camps along the river between Athens and Coolville begin to flood. Low sections of Harmony Road begin to flood. Much of the city of Athens is protected up to 26 feet by levees. The baseball fields in Nelsonville, adjacent to the river, flood. At 21.0 feet, South Canaan Road and Township Road 605 in the vicinity of US Route 50 flood. Glen Ebon Road begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM EDT Sunday was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage by Monday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.3 feet on 11/18/1985. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.
The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1030 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING
